text: i have been using this since 2008 back when it was rikaichan. always helpful. thank you so much
Been using this for a while now!! its really useful.

It isn't working at all for me.  No pop ups or anything.  It does have the  "On" tag over the extension logo but it doesn't seem to do anything at all. Alero Inyang seems to have had a similar experience.

Edit: ... I just had to refresh the browser after downloading the extension... バカみたいだ！(^_^;)
can't live without this extension thank you for my life
It's working on other sites, but I really need this for Wikipedia and it's not working there. Any way you can help?

I don't understand this... Rikaikun doesn't work at all! Nothing happens when I hover over Japanese text. No pop-up definition or reading, no text-to-speech, even though I enabled it in the Extension options. I thoroughly examined all the settings, and they remain default except for these:
I've selected "On click" for site access, 
I've pinned the extension to my toolbar, 
I've enabled text-to-speech. 

It used to work well when I installed it the first time, but then it stopped abruptly. I r... Show more
Hello Extension Creator, wouldn't it be possible to use an AI API to translate the text into other languages?
I love it, but I can't find a way to make it start when I start the browser.
Could have more languages besides english. I have to use the translator anyway, so it's not useful.
Doesn't work at all...But maybe we need to do something about settings but not information about it so useless.

This extension is perfect but I notice some bugs:
1. It gets on the way whatever japanese text I am typing exp when the cursor is near the text
2. It often turns on the "hide definitions and show only reading" by itself. It's not like there is shortcut to it, right??

Love the app.

but keyboard shortcut without clicking the icon would be super useful.

Thank you.

Good for reading difficult Japanese words on the fly, but not that great for studying to put words into your long-term memory because there is no integration with Anki (AnkiConnect). If you can add Anki integration I would use this over Yomichan since the popup design is prettier.
I use this extension on a daily basis. It's extremely handy, and I enjoy it.
cool but maybe pls change the color of the english translations like i mean the text color because it blends w the blue background and i hardly can read it
I love this extension. Its super helpful. If you could get it to work on PDF files while in chrome, that would take away my only complaint.
Thank you for making wonderful tool. I always introduce this function to Japanese Teacher who teach student with dyslexia. It works great.

I really love the extension. It looks like it uses JMdict under the hood, which makes its translations consistent with many other learning tools.

However, I have not been able to use it today on google Doc. I don't know whether this is because of an update from either Rikaikun or google, or just because of an issue on my end.

Hopefully the issue will be fixed in the future, or will fix itself if my environment's to blame.

Great tool anyaway.

Is it possible to enable text-to-speech, not automatically, but when I press a key? This is so it only pronounces the word when I want it to. Best is if the pronunciation could be repeated when my cursor is pointing at the word.

Pretty useful extension. For some reason, it won't let me translate phrases after a comma, so I'm forced to delete commas in sentences to use rikaikun to translate a word. Fixing this issue would be good for user experience.
I really really really love it, but sometimes it cannot be used, any tip to fix that?

No longer works on legacy versions of chrome before version ~90 or so.

The way this extension works is that you need to click the icon to enable it, then hover over the kanji/kana that you want to read and provides several potential readings up to 4 character long or so. Very straightforward and does the job well.

Helpful, but they should allow users to bind the keys. When a page is full of text with nowhere to put your mouse and the Enter key is stuck shifting the dictionaries, it's infuriating. Please allow users to change the controls.
It's great! Very useful extension.
very good

This is an absolute lifesaver. While I wish there was a slightly more comprehensive tutorial and list of commands in the options menu (I only discovered the names dictionary after coming back to the store page many months later), it does everything it needs to do and packs in so much functionality! While there are possibly some other quality of life changes that could be made, I don't think I can give this any less than 5*, especially seeing as it's totally free!
Absolutely amazing tool that made my life many times easier. However I think a font colour option would be helpful since the contrast is not ideal.
Only seems to work for Japanese websites, not Japanese text across the web in general; i.e. - doesn't translate if you're on an English site that uses Japanese text.
Love it!!! Very useful!!! Japanese salvation.

It's AMAZING! but saldly to make it work u have to install it and uninstall it over and over again cause IT WILL STOP WORKING after 1 o 2 days without any reason, and it's always the same, it works for 1 day or 2 and then it stops, so, 1 star for the idea! 0 star for the bad programming of the app! :/

I love this!! It has helped me a lot while reading Twitter and other websites in Japanese. The best part is you can check in a fast and easy way the reading of the word you want and at the same time, see the English definition so is a great way to learn kanji and vocabulary. 
Thank you for creating this!!! I always recommend this extension to other Japanese learners.
way too convenient to be true
I really like this extension, but it sometimes stops showing the English translations, so I have to remove  the extension and then add it back again. This happens every couple weeks. ;(
Is good but doesn't seem to work with certain fonts.
Seriously the best Japanese learning extension I've ever used. It makes everything easier to study. Thank you so much!
Doesn't work. Nothing is happening.
nice

great but would be better if:

-they'd remove the pinyin entries
-make it so "画像" doesn't pop up when you scroll over an image
Makes it really easy to go through a kanji heavy page. Thanks a million!
I love this extension, I've used it for years and it's helped me study so much. Big thank you to the creator <3

Rikaikun has been a life saver for over a decade.

I do have one problem... Recently it keeps resetting the highlight text setting, which is really annoying when you're trying to fill out a form and the text boxes keep losing focus. Not sure why this suddenly started happening, but it's the only problem I've ever had with the extension since it was first released.

This is amazing！（I would only work on adding popular authors’ and historical figures' names and book titles etc. to the database) (Also, when I try to copy paste with my keyboard, the extension bubble shows up, because I press SHIFT A or SHIFT V and then ENTER)

Otherwise, this add-on saves lives. Thank you so much for the effort of making it！
Works Great But How I wish it had Romji like RikaiChamp has for FireFox, O well I don't use chrome much anyways. ツ
very comfortable but sometime meaning not show how do I do. I try to enter/shift but not work

this is the best chrome extension i ever installed in my life. seriously.
both in term of usefulness and quality.
thank you very much.
Fantastic. One suggestion, it would be great it it could be disabled for cetain sites, instead of having to disable it manually. Thanks!

It gets the job done instantly. After moving to a NVMe SSD powered computer this extension starts up instantly. Now I'm able to use this in local .html files (like game manuals) just by activating all access rules in the extension config page of Opera GX.
A cool feature will be... "Go to some portal repository to search the highlighted text and see its real usage" I mean... perform a "Example Search" search in Kanshudo.

It's perfect!! However, a week ago it stopped working, it'll show how it's written but it won't say what does it mean, and it was lacking information. As the last update was from 2019 I thought it stopped working, but I decided to reinstall it just in case and now it works perfectly again. I should have done that sooner.

Enormously helpful extension. At some point, when language-learning, textbooks stop becoming useful and you just need to read constantly, and this is an indispensable tool.

That said, several very basic flaws that severely damage its functionality. 1) It never automatically loads upon start-up. 2) It insists on copy-pasting a definition (rather than the actual text), when I have never wanted to do that. And the definitions stick around even when you take your cursor away from the window, so ... Show more
It unfortunately doesn't seem to work with Youtube (titles and comments), otherwise it is good.
works everytime and is very helpful when understanding kanji
It's a great tool if you're trying to read single kanji's, but it's difficult to use when hiraganas are mixed in the words.
Works great for most sites but for some reason doesn't work on twitter. Otherwise I love it. Please fix that problem!
Great, This is tool that I'm looking for. please keep develop it. love them.
It doesn't show popup in Facebook website
I just downloaded it, but it doesn't seem to work for me? I turned it on, and started highlighting kanji, but nothing seems to pop up...help please

I've been using Rikaikun for years and it works great. Only thing is that it's missing some newer vocabulary terms as well as some expanded definitions/translations. If Jisho.org was integrated into rikaikun, that would be perfect. Also please consider adding the pitch shift number found in some dictionaries that can help with pitch accent pronunciation!

For those experiencing problems with it opening up, make sure your chrome is updated and try re-adding the extension.
powerful combo with Anki
I have using rikaikun for a couple of years now and I'm not going to stop any time soon. I use rikaikun to look up vocabulary and kanji. My Japanese have really improving thanks to rikaikun.
Really useful and saves my time to copy-and-paste to jisho or other translate/dict websites.

I love it but I realize sometimes I can't see the kanjis translated in English? I can saw the reading in hiragana or katakana instead. I turn off the extension and open again but it seems it doesn't work? I'll try to reinstall it.

Love it normally, but recently it started not showing translation, just reading. Gives no English unless I press shift/enter which just gives me the meaning (and translation) of the first kanji, not the word/phrase. Not sure why...
too good
Probably my first review on Chrome store. I am learning Japanese, and this app is super helpful.
Please add Romaji support
It's pretty great. If only it offered romaji transcription, it would be perfect.

This is my favorite extension that does what this does. However, it doesn't work properly on Google Docs (it only analyzes single characters), and works weirdly in general in text fields, like Google Translate (doesn't seem to know exactly where characters really are).
Also, C as non-changeable shortcut for copying sucks big time, because sometimes I want to copy the selected text, and it copies the entry. Actually, I'd expect to be able to customize or even deactivate all shortcuts separatel... Show more
Really helps

Excellent app. A wall I had in learning Japanese was my vocabulary. Having this app installed allows me to practice reading in context without having to use an online dictionary like Jisho every 5 seconds. 

It is not 100% flawless. Just wanted to make sure that is known, Ctrl+C will take the whole dictionary definition instead of the highlighted text. Manually right clicking and selecting Copy bypasses the issue but of course that's substandard.

Additionally, Rikaikun has difficulty on raw ... Show more
Extremely helpful! I would suggest this for all Japanese learners
Very Nice. Thank you for porting this extension to the Chrome Web Browser
Very good extension for reading Japanese website for non-native Japanese.
It's a great extension! Would be amazing if the romaji was shown too.

Rikaikun is very useful when reading newspaper articles etc. as I don't have to check a dictionary or skip every time there's a word I don't recognise. However, I've noticed a persistent problem - every few weeks or so, it just suddenly stops displaying English definitions, only displaying the kanji and onyomi/kunyomi when I hover over a word. I then need to remove and reinstall the extension and it starts working normally again. Toggling the on/off switch is also sometimes very slow and lagg... Show more
Thanks for this! Very helpful! But i have some troubles when i want to copy text, the whole dictionary is copied too with my text selection...
the only popup dictionary work with input text area, hhope you make another language like chinese and korean.
I like it but pressing on doesn't mean its on. it's annoying to have to press everytime i start up chrome, please fix this
Almost perfect, it does tell you the meaning of kanas and kanjis, but it does not do transliteration, or at least I didn't find it, so you will know what it means but you wont know the real word
This extension really helps me when I wanna read some article or something in Japanese. It's so good
Popular reading should be the first one.

Long startup lag. Often accidentally trigger hotkeys (which cannot be reassigned) when typing.

Biggest problem I have though is it now no longer works inside Google documents. I do some translating (J->E) and used to get a lot of use from rikaikun when editing a Japanese document in Google docs. I don't know if this issue was caused by Chrome, Google docs, or some change in rikaikun, but this is enough for me to take off another star.
Thank you. Sooo helpful.
The app itself is very good, but sometimes it just stops showing the english translations, I have to reinstall it everytime to make it work again.
pretty good, I can read with having to copy/paste to google translate for the kanji
I used to use it all the time. Now nothing pops up at all. Great.

Its really the best app I found until now for Kanjis. Most other get the reading wrong.

My only annoyance is that the popup window is too striking, it should have an option let it be a bit more transparent.

As someone who struggles with kanji, this is perfect! Works well on most sites, and the results are easy to read, although getting used to what all the information displayed means takes some getting used to.

If you know how to read Hiragana, this is the extension for you.

When hovering the mouse pointer above any Kanji, it will search and a popup will appear with the meaning.

Very helpfull!
Very useful when I'm reading long articles in Japanese rather than having to open up a Japanese dictionary. It even tells you what kind of conjugation the word is using and its other possibilities.

Copy/Paste is a problem! 

I don't have any real complaints about this extension, but I was wondering whether there had been an update recently that changed how copy-paste works with the extension. I feel like in the last month or two, hitting Cmd+C copies the dictionary entry for selected text. I know C is supposed to be the hotkey for copying to clipboard, but I'm getting really sick of selecting something, having the definition pop up, hitting Cmd+C and having the whole dictionary entry pa... very helpful, thank you

Learning Japanese, and only thing I don't have in Japanese is a large vocabulary, this is such a truly useful extension which already is helping me a lot as I learned more Japanese words today than I have in a week.

someone please update it it's open source
thank you for make Rikaikun. i love it

Incredibly useful for browsing. It has a surprising amount of knowledge about specific areas. For example, knowing 圏 as "category" in the context of category theory.

This is a fantastic app. It's one of the best and in some cases it's a make or break extention when determining which computer to use for work. I'd even say I'm very grateful to the developers. 

That said, it works well on Firefox and only there. Its cousin's potential here in Chrome hasn't been realized. This is the only reason I have fully switched to  Chrome. 

I wish it would equally as well on both browsers. It's a huge disappointment that it so underperforms on Chrome.

help me alot

This app got me really excited! It still does, but it doesn't seem to work on most sites, which is disappointing. The sites I was hoping this app would help me with, seem to be immune to it's power. If this app worked on all sites/documents etc, I would pay for it. I hope you find a way to fix this - お願いします！
Fast and useful.

It is useful of course, but it's so much worse than it's contemporary in Mozilla Firefox. On Rikaikun is slow to start up. It's almost instant in Mozilla. And recently, I've been having problems where it's only showing the reading of the word (that is, it shows how to pronounce it) and doesn't show the meanings of the words, which defeats the purpose. This needs to be fixed!
Absolutely amazing tool for understanding/learning Japanese.
Very useful.
when it works it is good and really is helping. when it works, that is. bcs 80% of the time i can't even turn on the feature

MUST HAVE!!!!
great for reading

my favourite

amazing app, helps me a lot with kanji that I don't recognize.

Great Extension!

I love this extension because it has saved me so much time looking up word definitions. Sometimes, you just want to check that you remember the reading or meaning of a word, or what an unknown kanji means, and rikaikun is great for that!
Thank you soooooo much for this!!!! I find it indispensable all the time!
Why haven't I installed it earlier? It would have saved me so much time.

I am on Chrome (oviously xD) and i will turn it on and go to the Japanese website thatsfull of kanji (cause I cant read kanji....) and it dosent work so then i try it on Clip Studio Paint because i wa investing on the trial but could read it (due yet again to kanji) and tried it there. I heard a lot of positive stuff about it but when I cant use it because something dosent work then I can only rate it negitively. It should be fixed somehow because when it is I will be usings it 24/7 basiclly xD

Great tool but if you are not careful will ultimately cripple your ability to read. I like the option to change what pops up. I wish this had an additional flashcard option where you could save certain words for a flashcard system like Anki or something.
Indispensable.
It's extremely amazing, it has great word detection. I love it. However i hope this extension can work offline.
A MUST HAVE for 日本語 (JP) studying. I teach a lot of JP online and this is one of the first things I have my students grab, for every level.

Great for looking up words and phrases that you don't know. The only reason I put 4 stars is because if you are reading the news (for example) and your mouse is in the middle of the page you are going to be picking up readings of words that you don't want (aka the pop-up box will get in the way). So you need to learn how to precariously position the mouse to get through long articles
Best extension to translate Japanese page.

love it

4.9 stars. Excellent extension that is an incredibly helpful for me. The good far outweighs the minor issues. 
BTW, the minor issues are (1) it says "ON" even when not, especially when chrome is started up, (2) loading time is very long (perhaps this is a chrome issue? but rikaichan for firefox was quite fast.
Thanks to the developer for the super useful extension!!

Very cool extension

So useful for anyone working with/using/loving Japanese, a must-have most certainly!
Very useful for me who is learning Japanese. It saves me a lot of time to search the meaning especially the furigana as I always forget the newly learned words.
